text: Thinley Dorji (born 20 November 1950), is an archer who internationally represented Bhutan Dorji competed for Bhutan at two Summer Olympics, he was part of the first team to compete at the Olympics for Bhutan when he took part in the 1984 Summer Olympics held in Los Angeles, where he finished 53rd, four years later he competed in the 1988 Summer Olympics held in Seoul, he finished 73rd in the individual event and the team finished 22nd in the team event.Sports Reference Profile ==References== Category:1950 births Category:Living people Category:Olympic archers of Bhutan Category:Archers at the 1984 Summer Olympics Category:Archers at the 1988 Summer Olympics Category:Bhutanese male archers Category:Asian Games competitors for Bhutan
title: Thinley Dorji (archer)
